summary: The 2024 Haryana Legislative Assembly elections were held on October 5, 2024, to elect 90 members. The Election Commission announced the schedule on August 16, 2024, and results were declared on October 8. Despite predictions of a Congress victory, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) won the most seats (48), securing its third consecutive term. The Congress won 37 seats. Nayab Singh Saini of the BJP was the Chief Minister before the elections. The previous Assembly's term was to end on November 3, 2024.
title: 2024 Haryana Legislative Assembly election
